resources.string: Day 1: Morning jog around Burnham Park Lake
A jog around the lake in the early morning can boost your mental state and improve your energy levels for the day.
Day 2: Practice yoga or tai chi on the park lawns.
Yoga or tai chi activities can help you relax and reduce stress.
Day 3: Sketch or paint the scenic views of the park
Paint your favorite area in the park, use any medium you want and be expressive. Take your time in building your art.
Day 4: Have a picnic under the trees with family or friends.
Time to bring some friends or family with you and have a picnic under the trees. Bring your favorite snacks and drinks that you have been saving at home.
Day 5: Bird watching and identifying local species.
There are many local species of birds flocking around the lake on quiet days. Try visiting in the morning for a calmer experience with bird watching.
Day 6: Join or form a morning exercise group.
Various groups are seen exercising the park in the morning, try joining one and make friends in the process. You may also form a group of your own with your new friends.
Day 7: Capture the sunset with your camera or smartphone.

Afternoons are perfect for experiencing a busier side of the park as residents pass by to enjoy the park after a day of working or school. This is also a good time to witness the setting sun wrap the park in an orange glow.
